title: So i finally ran into something that stumped me.
body:
Counterplay for malph ult, i couldnt figure it out aside from just guessing when hes gonna ult and flashing out of it.

Any ideas.

Besides the Banshee's Veil a lot of people have motioned towards, one of the key factors of when a Malphite is going to ult, is how he positions himself. Most of the time a Malphite sits quite neutrally, just in front of his team, but quite often when he thinks he can hit an ultimate, he will move forward in a straight line towards his target.

The best way to learn how he ults is to **play** him! Get a feel for when a Malphite uses his ult and as such learn to beat it!

Im talking more during laning phase, malphs in general have a pretty bad history of waiting till i move up to get a single cs then ulting me and instagibbing me, rinse repeat everytime i come back to lane.

I guess you'll need to respect malphites damage more. He does a lot of magic damage from his Ultimate, Q and E. Having some magic resist in your build,  for example a {{item:3211}} Spectre's Cowl will mean he shouldn't be able to poke you due to the health regen gained, along with not being able to get bursted from full due to bonus MR and HP. Communicate to your jungler how easy it could be to bait him in and then turn it with a 2v1 after he engages. Malphite has no escapes without his ultimate, so try to communicate this with your team and ask for help!

I've also just noticed that you're picking very squishy ranged AD top's and also not building any defensive items in any of your builds on champs such as Cho'Gath. Try to avoid picking an Attack damage based carry against Malphite, as these specifically are who his kit is built to counter. (Hexdrinker would work better on these champs than Spectre's Cowl, but if you CAN avoid picking these champs into Malphite I'd recommend it.)

Lastly, if you're frustrated when playing against Malphite with your champion pool for ranked, ask for a ban on him nicely.

Most of the games i played against malph he actually picks them into me, whenever i see a malph when im picking i usually go something like say poppy so if he tries to ult me i can come down still alive and burst him down with my e q combo.

Cho gath games i was mostly fucking around.

Kindred i actually build full tank so shes far from squishy (usually around 4k health with 200 armor and 100+ mr while still having ad)

As for lucian, won more games than ive lost using full ap lucian top, bronze elo doesnt respect his burst potential ( that and i get to sit just out of range and poke with w)

Banning isnt really possible as jax xin and darius are pretty much on perma ban and because most of bronze bans stupid shit like the donger i have to take the mantle to ban the hypercarries.

Id say "Wha wha my junglers dont listen" but youve heard it before.

End of the day im basically looking for real counter play that i can do myself by myself as i can only rely on myself.

Building mr while good on paper would more than likely result in the same thing, for instance this ult combo stuff can start around 8 minutes in, at 10 minutes with perfect cs (which i dont have because im bronze) id have roughly 1600 gold from cs, not counting any pots wards or boots that means i can buy a total of 35 mr in the form of spectres cowl, or 60 mr if i wanted to totally gimp the rest of my laning phase and get another null mantle.

This would bring me up to around 90 mr with 200 bonus health. and remember thats 10 minutes of 100% perfect cs, not the 8 minutes i actually have before i get gibbed and the poor cs i have from having to deal with a malph poking me down.

at that much mr i have just shy of 50% damage reduction which means a 2* effective health multiplier.

Now lets say im my usual pick i should have around 1500 health, meaning 3k ehp against magic damage.

now if we use base level 1 damages from malphite along with the ap from the usual dorans ring start his ult does 215 damage, 79 damage from his q, around 91 damage from his w enhanced autos, and around 70 damage from his ground slam.

Now if we dont count the autos as they are phys damage thats  364 damage, which is a tad over 10% of my 3k ehp.

Which sounds likes its not alot but as i said earlier that with level 1 basics, if he so much as put 2 more points in q that damage ramps up to 464, which is about 15%, and then he can gleefully sit there and auto me down as im slowed by 20% of my ms which is granted to him by said q.

Flash out of it? well sure i can flash one of them, but the next 2 engages are going to work as the cooldown for his ulty at level one is only 130 seconds compared to flashes 300 without masteries or ionians.

I know i sound like im just making excuses but those numbers are why i wanted counterplay not damage mitigation, if it was as simple as building some mr i wouldve been rushing spectres every game, the issue is that i can mitigate the damage, but that doesnt mean im suddenly allowed to walk up to my cs and hit it to get the gold to buy more mr when he goes and gets ap.

On the other hand if mr is literally my only option and it still doesnt work i guess i have a reason to QQ and dodge games when i see a malph, either that or develop psychic powers so i can predict when hyper aggressive bronzies that are always past the trading zone are gonna ult (you legit cant tell when a bronze malph is gonna ult because the position you'd expect to see a malph to ult from is where they always are, which helps if you got enough range to poke em hence my love of black magic but sucks when trying to avoid the ult)

I understand your frustration, but your math is a little out. 

 **Minion Gold** 
 12.5 minions @ ~20gold per minion for ~ 6 minutes (2:00-8:00 mins) =  1500gold

**Ambient Gold**
20.4 Gold per 10 seconds for 360 seconds = 734gold

Would give you 2234 gold. The price of 2 spectres cowls. 
Now even missing 30% of those cs would bring you to the 1734 gold mark.
Spectres Cowl + Boots + 2 pots = 1500 gold

Personally I wouldnt necessarily say Spectre's is _the most_ ideal item against him. On bruisers like Poppy you can go for a {{item:3751}} which can help your trading and keeping his shield off without needing to use a spell or auto him. 

If you say you are struggling against the Dorans start Malphite, consider the fact he will have less sustain than most tops, and can only use his q as poke. If you buy {{item:1054}}  or {{item:2033}} you will have more HP sustain. If you are able to trade effectively early and bully him off CS it will drain his sustain (which recently got Nerfed in 6.4) and grow your lead this way. Remember Malph has no escape pre-6, so putting him in a vulnerable position to cs with poke can lead to big leads and early kills to snowball on him. 

As for dodging ultimates, Rusty mentioned they read very differently when looking to ultimate. You mention it isnt' obvious due to them always being over extended, but remember his passive cannot refresh when he gains minion aggro, which takes a while to drop if forward in lane. This is a way you can win trades on him.

I hope some of these tips help in your games.

Real problem is even if you position your self for his ult, he will just up one person and end up killing that one person with his combo or with help and that then makes it 4v5. By the time that person is back up his got his ult again so the cycle continues!
if you time it right fiora's "w" riposte, its hard but can be done

ways to stop getting killed by Malphite ult or lower the risk of losing the game:

- Don't group. (team fights)
- Time Flash well.
- Banshee's/ Zhonyas Hourglass.


P.S. nothing can stop Malphite once he uses his ultimate not any CC at all so just move or get a spell shield and Good Luck on Summoners Rift!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
A spellshield or xin's r.
Just before he gets into Ult range walk towards him and spam laugh as he lands just past you.

There aren't that many routes for counterplay against a malphite ultimate. 
Best I can think of is:

* Don't group (obviously)
* Flash if you can predict his movements/have godlike reaction times
* Banshees veil
